00680 /*
00681  * CLI Parser assumes the following types are defined: uint8_t, int8_t,
00682  * uint16_t, int16_t, uint32_t, int32_t. In many platforms (including
00683  * all platforms with GNU toolchain), stdint.h defines these types.
00684  * Thus, including this file is sufficient. If your platform does not 
00685  * have these types defined, you need to define them here.
00686  */
00687 #include <stdint.h>
00688 
00689 /*
00690  * This is to match Cisco CLI behavior. For example, if there is a
00691  * command "show crypto interfaces", one can just enter "sh cry int"
00692  * if no other command has the same prefix form.
00693  */
00694 #define SHORTEST_UNIQUE_KEYWORD
00695 
00699 typedef enum cparser_result_ {
00700     CPARSER_OK = 0,
00701     CPARSER_NOT_OK,
00702     CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS, 
00703     CPARSER_ERR_NOT_EXIST,      
00704     CPARSER_ERR_OUT_OF_RES,     
00705     CPARSER_ERR_PARSE_ERR,      
00706     CPARSER_ERR_INCOMP_CMD,     
00707     CPARSER_MAX_RESULTS
00708 } cparser_result_t;

00795 typedef enum cparser_state_ {

00807 struct cparser_ {
00809     cparser_cfg_t     cfg;
00811     int               root_level;
00813     cparser_node_t    *root[CPARSER_MAX_NESTED_LEVELS];
00815     char              prompt[CPARSER_MAX_NESTED_LEVELS][CPARSER_MAX_PROMPT];
00817     cparser_node_t    *cur_node;
00818 
00819     /********** FSM states **********/
00820     cparser_state_t   state;       
00821     short             token_tos;   
00822     short             current_pos; 
00824     short             last_good;
00826     cparser_token_t   tokens[CPARSER_MAX_NUM_TOKENS]; /* parsed tokens */
00828     int               is_privileged_mode;
00829 
00830     /********** Line buffering states **********/
00831     short             max_line;
00832     short             cur_line;
00833     cparser_line_t    lines[CPARSER_MAX_LINES];
00834 
00836     int               done;   
00838     cparser_context_t context;
00839 
00840     /********** User input **********/
00842     char              *user_buf;
00844     int               user_buf_size;
00846     int               user_buf_count;
00848     int               user_do_echo;
00850     cparser_input_cb  user_input_cb;
00851 
00852     /********** Last executed command **********/
00854     int               last_line_idx;
00856     cparser_result_t  last_rc;
00858     cparser_node_t    *last_end_node;
00859 };
